program main
    implicit none
    character(len=2000) :: s, result
    integer :: i, len_s, pos
    logical :: is_latin, is_punct

    ! Read input line

    ! Print the result, trimming trailing spaces
    print '(a)', trim(result)

contains
    logical function is_latin(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_latin = (c >= 'a' .and. c < = 'z') .or. (c >= 'A' .and. c < = 'Z')
    end function is_latin

    logical function is_punct(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_punct = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
    end function is_punct

end program main

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=2000) :: s, result
    integer :: i, len_s, pos
    logical :: is_latin, is_punct

    ! Read input line
    read(*, '(a)') s

    len_s = len_trim(s)  ! Process up to the last non-space character

    if (len_s == 0) then
        print *, ''
        stop
    end if

    ! Initialize result with the first character
    result = ' '  ! Initialize to spaces
    result(1:1) = s(1:1)
    pos = 2

    do i = 2, len_s
        if (is_latin(s(i:i))) then
            if (.not. is_latin(s(i-1:i-1))) then
                if (pos <= 2000) then
                    result(pos:pos) = ' '
                    pos = pos + 1
                end if
            end if
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end if
        else if (is_punct(s(i:i))) then
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
if
        end if
    end do

    ! Print the result up to pos-1
    if (pos > 1) then
        print '(a)', result(1:pos-1)
    else
        print '(a)', ''
    end if

contains
    logical function is_latin(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_latin = (c >= 'a' .and. c < = 'z')
    end function is_latin

    logical function is_punct(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_punct = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
    end function is_punct

end program main

This should handle trailing spaces correctly.

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=2000) :: s, result
    integer :: i, len_s, pos
    logical :: is_latin, is_punct

    ! Read input line
    read(*, '(a)') s

    len_s = len_trim(s)  ! Get the length without trailing spaces?

    if (len_s == 0) then
        print *, ''
        stop
    end if

    ! Initialize result with the first character
    result = ' '
    result(1:1) = s(1:1)
    pos = 2

    do i = 2, len_s
        if (is_latin(s(i:i))) then
            if (.not. is_latin(s(i-1:i-1))) then
                if (pos <= 2000) then
                    result(pos:pos) = ' '
                    pos = pos + 1
                end if
            end if
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end if
        else if (is_punct(s(i:i))) then
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end if
        end if
    end do

    ! Print the result, trimming trailing spaces
    print '(a)', trim(result)

contains
    logical function is_latin(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_latin = (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') .or. (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z')
    end function is_latin

    logical function is_punct(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_punct = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
    end function is_punct

end program main

But what if pos exceeds the buffer length?

Assuming that the buffer is large enough (2000), but if the input is very long, pos may exceed 2000. However, in practice, the problem's constraints may allow this, but for the purpose of this code, we'll assume the input is not longer than 2000 characters.

So modifying the code:

At the end, print result(1:pos-1)

So in the Fortran code:

print '(a)', result(1:pos-1)

This way, all characters up to pos-1 are printed, including any trailing spaces.

Thus, the final code would be:

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=2000) :: s, result
    integer :: i, len_s, pos
    logical :: is_latin, is_punct

    ! Read input line
    read(*, '(a)') s

    len_s = len_trim(s)  ! Process up to the last non-space character

    if (len_s == 0) then
        print *, ''
        stop
    end if

    ! Initialize result with the first character
    result = ' '  ! Initialize to spaces
    result(1:1) = s(1:1)
    pos = 2

    do i = 2, len_s
        if (is_latin(s(i:i))) then
            if (.not. is_latin(s(i-1:i-1))) then
                if (pos <= 2000) then
                    result(pos:pos) = ' '
                    pos = pos + 1
                end if
            end if
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end if
        else if (is_punct(s(i:i))) then
            if (pos <= 2000) then
                result(pos:pos) = s(i:i)
                pos = pos + 1
            end if
        end if
    end do

    ! Print the result up to pos-1
    if (pos > 1) then
        print '(a)', result(1:pos-1)
    else
        print '(a)', ''
    end if

contains
    logical function is_latin(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_latin = (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z')
    end function is_latin

    logical function is_punct(c)
        character(len=1), intent(in) :: c
        is_punct = c == '.' .or. c == ',' .or. c == '!' .or. c == '?'
    end function is_punct

end program main
